III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• There was no technical assistance requested or required.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• There was no consultation requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.

There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance:
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during
this period under review.
Chief Administrator Assessment:
Chief Administrator Assessment was reviewed. Chief Administrator (CA) reported
during this current review period from 8/12/24 – 4/20/25, Christ Child Detroit’s
foster care program incurred no licensing violations, statutory breaches, contract
non-conformities, or corrective action requirements. All foster homes files, service
plans, and safety assessments were found in full compliance with applicable
MDHHS Child Placing Agency rules and federal IV-E standards. This Consultant
had a discussion with the CA regarding the licensed foster homes the agency
services. It was discussed that the agency needs to continue to recruit foster
parents/foster homes for the agency to increase their numbers.
Financial Overview:
The agency certified independent auditor’s report dated December 31,2023, and
the agency annual financial budget was reviewed. There were no financial
concerns identified.
Staff Interviews:
The staff members interviewed reported being supported and assisted by their
coworkers and management. They love working at the agency and reported no
safety concerns.
Description of Agency Walk Through:
The office has adequate space and equipment for the staff members to complete
their required responsibilities. Physical CHRI and case files are all stored securely,
preventing unauthorized access. No concerns were noted.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There was one safety alert.
Safety Alert:
Unlicensed Relative had a toilet in the bathroom that was leaking, the
floor in the bathroom structure is not stable due to the leaking toilet. There was

water observed in the basement due to the pipes leaking from the bathroom. The
pipes in the basement are rotting.
Resolution:
Due to this being an unlicensed relative home, a special evaluation was not opened
on home. The Program Manager conducted a home visit on 4/24/2025 and
inspected the areas described in the safety alert. The Program Manager and the
unlicensed relative mutually agreed to a safety plan and repair plan. The first priority
is stabilizing the floor and toilet to be anchored properly with appropriate flooring. The
Program Manager will inspect the repair on 5/2/2025, The second priority is the
basement pipe and leak. There is a minor leak/slow drip coming from the pipe
basement. The pipe itself may need to be replaced if the rust is throughout the
jointed area. Adjacent to the pipe is a plastic pipe which does have some
discoloration such as rust. Unlicensed relative will have a plumber/repair man to
inspect both areas and provide a permanent solution to resolve the safety concerns.
The repair man will be coming to the home on 5/3/2025 and reportedly is a two day
job. The Program Manager will physically inspect the repair work and provide photos.
RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their
regular license.
